result.execSummary:
The defendant Jabe Johnson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Current with any other sentence. Credit for 180 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers. No alcohol or controlled substances.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.  Successfully complete a Parenting Program.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Restitution set at zero. Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jabe Johnson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (44 pages) commencing 06/06/2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee appeared by Kurt Behling.
Deputy Court Clerk:  sa
Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.
Return of property hearing on July 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Also referenced ATN #41004149640073, arrest date 3-7-14, MCSO.

Defendant Jabe Johnson in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Jabe Johnson in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 180 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Advance vocational skills
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Michael L Chernin in court, defendant Jabe Johnson not in court, in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in trial, plea and sentencing is re-scheduled.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael L Chernin in court, defendant Jabe Johnson not in court, in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 5/29/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Jabe Johnson not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court grants the substitution.  Case is retabbed to Br. 15, Judge Watts.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody at MSDF.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jabe Johnson in court staging. Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court .  Defendant Jabe Johnson in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This case was assigned to the wrong court due to this is a gun case. Case now reassigned to Branch 44, Judge Konkol. File going to Branch 44, forthwith, for setting a date before Branch 44.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Jabe Johnson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Jabe Johnson in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
